newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Former Australian leader sees Native Title flaws.
newsitem.headline: Former Australian leader sees Native Title flaws.

text.p: Former Australian governor-general Bill Hayden said on Thursday that there were glaring defects in the Native Title Act on aboriginal land ownership rights.

Hayden said he was expressing concern as part of his report to the Queensland state government as chief negotiator in recent unsuccessful land right negotiations over the A$1 billion Century Zinc project in far north Queensland.

"It is a glaring defect of the Native Title Act's right-to-negotiate process that one self-appointed claimant.... could frustrate a successful outcome to these processes," Hayden said in his letter to Queensland premier Rob Borbidge.

The Century project is currently owned by Anglo-Australian mining house RTZ Plc-CRA Ltd but the group has agreed to sell the project to local base metals firm Pasminco Ltd for A$345 million, subject to resolution of any land rights claims.
